activities: Edwards receives human resources information regarding its European employees for centralized record-keeping and processing in the United States. Edwards also receives personal information about research subjects, patients, investigators and staff, service providers, and healthcare professionals all in support of Edwards' clinical research operations. Finally, Edwards receives personal information in both electronic and manual form from the EU to carry out a variety of business-related activities, such as customer service, health information services, marketing, and product development, distribution and quality monitoring.
contacttitle1: Vice President, Assistant General Counsel & Privacy Owner
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resources Data, Clinical trial data
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
